docs.text: in _daylight_ , sylvester stallone breaks no new ground , cinematically speaking , but he covers familiar territory quite well .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: yesterday , as i was going about my business in the university bookstore , i noticed this stand with these _daylight_ movie posters on it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i had never heard of the movie , so i stopped by to check it out .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it turned out that they were giving away free passes to the movie for people who had or applied for the credit card they were offering .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: so , i shrugged , thought , " hey , they probably won't give me the card anyway , and i could always use a free movie , " so i signed up .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: all in all , i don't think i got that bad of a deal , either .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: rob cohen , who has previously brought us such films as _dragon : the bruce lee story_ and , more recently , _dragonheart_ ( gee , i wonder if he likes dragons for some reason ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: you think ? ) , now brings us a very nicely executed disaster picture , with fx by industrial light and magic , about the after-effects of an explosion that collapses a busy tunnel between new york and new jersey .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sylvester stallone plays kit latura , who is essentially a carbon copy of the character he played in _cliffhanger_ : a paramedic on the outs because he made a mistake that got people killed .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when the crisis hits , he is in the right place at the right time and takes it upon himself to go in and get everybody out .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there are other similarities to _cliffhanger_ , too ; perhaps the only real difference is that _cliffhanger_ had a villain , where _daylight_'s bad guy is mother nature .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in fact , had the two movies been made in hong kong , this might have been titled _cliffhanger ii_--it bears the same relationship to that film that most hk film " sequels " do to their predecessors .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the first half-hour of _daylight_ is setup .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: subplots are woven , and the mechanism of the disaster is assembled .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we meet all the important people . . . toxic waste disposal truck drivers ; a young , frustrated , jilted , rejected playwright ; a family struggling to stay together ; an older couple and their dog ; a truckload of prisoners ; an ad agency executive ; a tunnel police officer ; stallone ; and others .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we watch the trucks trundle toward their destination ; we watch stallone and so many others driving toward the tunnel for their various reasons .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and then , thirty minutes into the film , _boom_ .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and it's a big one .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: >from there on in , it's sly stallone to the rescue .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and rescue he does , enduring batterings , beatings , falls , repeated immersion in 34-degree water , explosions , mud , rats , and constant setbacks , before going on to save the day , sly-style .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: again . . . there's
docs.label: positive

docs.text: nothing new here .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and yet there doesn't need to be .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the fun of _daylight_ is not in the story but in the execution .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the special-effects are first-rate , thanks to industrial light and magic , and the ensemble cast works well together .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: once the film hits its stride , it carries the viewer right along to the finish , with very few jars along the way .
docs.label: positive
